reviews.text: This is a fabulous place to stay! Our only mistake was to book it through Simply Travel rather than direct, as they messed up the booking (we think they just forgot to book it) and we ended up with a standard room rather than the self-catering one we'd expected. reviews.text: We're living proof that a car's not essential to stay here, though I guess it would have been a big help. However, it's an hour's pleasant walk along the lavada into Funchal and between 5 and 10 Euros by taxi back (it's remote enough that most taxi drivers didn't have a clue where to go!).

reviews.text: Thanks once again to Filomena and her kind and hospitable staff (big smile), thanks for the studio Oliveira, the patio and the pool, thanks for the bananas and the big bag of mixed salads, thanks to the cats and dogs, thanks for the view over Funchal and the sea, thanks for the wonderful breakfasts and candlelight dinners under open air, for the wine, for the company of your others guests, thanks for the recipes from your kitchen, thanks for making us love this week in Madeira. It could not have been more pleasant.
reviews.title: The sweetest hotel in Funchal?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a self-cattering room, palmeira room I think. It was spacious, with a huge bathroom, a small kitchen corner, and unfortunatly, a twin bed, but we knew that there was no double bed available for these dates. The only thing I didn't really like about the room is that it slightely smelt of dampness: the carpets, the curtains, the chaires. It also needed some renovation, the curtains, the couch and those kind of stuff used to be white and looked rather used and a little bit dirty. However the bed itself and the sheets smelt normal and fresh, so it was ok with me. I couldn't have slept in a bed smelling dampness, and I got used to the smell of the room too. The view from the terrace is fantastic, especially on good weather. You can take the chaires and the table out the room to have breakfast or a drink by your own on the terrace. The actully used the kitchen to cook very simple meals. There is a big supermarket close to the place. The only thing that lacked in the kitchen were small things like salt, oil, napkins, dish soap, things you don't want to buy for 5 days. However, it was enough to ask for that and we got it. We asked for the homemade jam and salad for our first self-cattering breakfast and had it all for free. I also recomend to try the breakfast served in the hotel itself. It was a great value. For 5 euros by person, you get all sort of homemade jams, eggs to order, pancakes, fruits and vegetables. It was really worth it. The animals (a couple of old dogs and a few cats) which have access to the public area are not ennoying at all. Even my partener who doesn't like animals didn't mind. The owner, Filomena, was very nice. She spoke French (we are French). We were also offered a promotional rate for a 5 days staying, although on the internet it was intented for a 7 nights staying. By the end of our trip I asked for homemade jams to buy and we were offered two huge bocals of pitanga and goyava jams for free, although I had the intention to pay for it. It was very nice. I would recommend this place. We hired a car, so we didn't have any problem with going downtown or close villages. There is no specific parking lot, but it's safe and convinient to leave the car just outside the main door, in a small street.
reviews.title: A welcoming place

likes.liked: — the service, the breakfast and homemade jams, the independence
likes.disliked: — smell of dampness and need of cleaning of white curtains, carpets and coach

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived we were made very welcome. Filomena gave us a guided tour of the hotel and grounds. The view from our bedroom was stunning- looking over the sea with the sunshine all day. Breakfast was substantial with cereals, fresh fruit, bread and cheese and ham and even a cooked breakfast on request. The home made jam was terrific - made with fresh fruit picked from the garden. If required, lunch and evening meal could be obtained if booked that morning. All the staff were very courteous and were always eager to please. We were encouraged to use the private facilities of the hotel and had free access to the internet. There was a cosmopolitan air around the hotel - guests from Germany,Sweden, Denmark, France, Brazil, England and Scotland. On booking, guests had a choice of Self catering or bed and breakfast. There was an excellent swimming pool where one could relax after a strenous "levada walk". All in all, a holiday to be remembered.
reviews.title: A touch of paradise!!!

likes.liked: — Excellent service from all hotel staff and the tranquility away from the bustle of Funchal town.
likes.disliked: — A 5-10 minute walk , up a fairly steep hill, from the hotel to the bus stop.

likes.liked: — Light and airy rooms. Friendly and helpful staff.

reviews.text: Unfortunately our flight was delayed so by the time we arrived in Madeira it was dark which made for an interesting drive. Despite following the directions we were emailed we still managed to get lost. We arrived at what appeared in the dark to be an extremely steep road that just disappeared into an abyss. Being tired, unable to find reverse, my wife nearly got out of the hire car as she thought we were about to go over a cliff. After teetering on the edge for some minutes we drove back up the into the hills from where we rang Philomena. She very kindly sent out her husband to rescue us from our stupidity and took us back to the 'cliff' next to which was the hotel.
